content:
It's a good idea to follow up, especially since it's been some time since your application. Keep your email professional and concise. Here's a suggested structure:

Subject: Follow-Up on Application for VA Programmer

Dear Fatima Zahra,

I hope this email finds you well. I am writing to follow up on my application for the VA Programmer position submitted on [date]. Since I have not yet received any feedback, I wanted to kindly check if there have been any updates regarding the status of my application.

I remain very interested in the opportunity to contribute to your team and would greatly appreciate any information you can share.

Thank you for your time and consideration. Please feel free to contact me if you require any additional information.

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best regards,
Hamza Bouras
[Your Contact Information]

This shows your professionalism and interest without being pushy. What do you think?

Here’s a simpler version:

Subject: Follow-Up on VA Programmer Application

Hi Fatima Zahra,

I hope you're doing well. I wanted to follow up on my application for the VA Programmer position submitted on [date]. It's been a while, and I wanted to check if there are any updates regarding the process.

Thank you for your time. I look forward to hearing from you.

Best regards,
Hamza Bouras

This keeps it casual and straightforward while still being polite. Does this work for you?
